001package net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns;
002
003import java.lang.annotation.*;
004
005/**
006 * Marks a class or interface as a <b>Facade</b> in the
007 * <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Facade_pattern">Facade design pattern</a>.
008 * <p>
009 * A Facade is a structural pattern that provides a simplified, high-level
010 * interface to a complex subsystem. It shields clients from the details of
011 * subsystem classes and reduces the learning curve by exposing only the
012 * most commonly used functionality.
013 * </p>
014 *
015 * <h2>Typical roles:</h2>
016 * <ul>
017 *   <li><b>Facade</b> – the class or interface annotated with {@code @Facade};
018 *       it defines simple, coarse-grained methods for client use.</li>
019 *   <li><b>Subsystem classes</b> – the detailed components hidden behind the facade;
020 *       they perform the actual work.</li>
021 *   <li><b>Client</b> – interacts only with the facade, not with subsystem classes directly.</li>
022 * </ul>
023 */
024@Documented
025@DesignPattern(DesignPattern.Category.STRUCTURAL)
026@Retention(RetentionPolicy.SOURCE)
027@Target(ElementType.TYPE)
028public @interface Facade {
029}
